{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3683640,"name":"Alex Tsekhansky","username":"atsekhan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/0ea827/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-18T13:14:58.830Z","cooked":"

I am trying to reinstall Advantagescope, but when I uninstall/reinstall it from the github download (not from WPI ISO install), I get

Failed to load assets
Some asset files failed to load. Check the developer console for details.

How can I do proper cleanup and install some working version of it? I tried uninstall it, cleanup directory where the install was, and reinstall it back - no success. May be some registry entries or some other directory I need to delete?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2025-07-18T13:14:58.830Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":115,"readers_count":114,"score":68.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504384,"topic_slug":"advantagescope-clean-reinstall","display_username":"Alex Tsekhansky","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50762,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/advantagescope-clean-reinstall/504384/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3684921,"name":"Jonah Bonner","username":"jonahb55","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jonahb55/{size}/194474_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-19T20:40:27.817Z","cooked":"

Have you tried to add any custom assets to AdvantageScope? If not, that error definitely shouldn’t be appearing. If you’re willing, I’d appreciate it if you can gather some additional data so we can debug the underlying issue.

You can open AdvantageScope’s developer console by clicking “View” > “Toggle Developer Tools”. It should print out a list of the specific assets that failed to load. You can then find the directory of assets at %userprofile%\AppData\Roaming\AdvantageScope\autoAssets. It will be easiest to debug the issue if you can create and upload a zip file of any assets that AdvantageScope failed to load (you should be able to upload it here or send a link).

You should be able to force the app to download the correct assets by closing AdvantageScope, deleting the autoAssets folder, and reopening AdvantageScope.

Deleting autoAssets after uninstall solved the issue. Thanks!
